message: I think it would make a whole lot of sense to have (possibly toggleable, since not everyone may want to have their browser keyboard hijacked) keyboard shortcuts for navigating in and between topics.

@joonas I really like this idea. I'm a big fan of keyboard shortcuts. I think it would make sense with the overall flow of the site since it's mainly communication-based and users are likely doing a lot of typing. It would help to be able to keep my hands at the keyboard more.

@JohnFail that's precisely what I was trying to get at, being able to keep my hands on the keyboard all the time instead of having to reach for the mouse every so often to do tasks that could be accomplished with keyboard, thus making the site more usable.
"gi" for getting back to the index please :-) In general I really like the vi/gmail shortcuts from navigating online.
@zerok that was my source of initial inspiration for this, I'd love to use gg and G to navigate to the top and bottom of the conversation, ctrl-u and ctrl-d for doing a "page" at a time..
Agree. When I first opened a conversation I was pressing J/K to navigate the posts and nothing happened. I was disappointed.
The best keyboard shortcuts are the ones...in my emacs!  Where's the convore emacs client?
I think something else that goes with this (removing the mouse dependency, etc.) is making sure the text input retains its focus whenever you switch back to Convore.
